intro: Crossandrella laxispicata, commonly known as the narrow-spurred crossandrella, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white to pale pink flowers. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
